skeptics.name: Adrian Covert
skeptics.title: Journalist
skeptics.excerpt: The lulz were abundant. But frankly, it’s time for you to go. Farewell.

skeptics.name: Michael Calore
skeptics.title: Journalist
skeptics.article: Wired, Tired, Expired for 2012: From Stellar to Suck
skeptics.excerpt: Then came the malware, the black market, the legal ambiguities and The Man. Today, you can't even use it to buy Facebook stock

skeptics.name: Tim Worstall
skeptics.title: Journalist
skeptics.article: So, That's the End of Bitcoin Then
skeptics.excerpt: It’s difficult to see what the currency has going for it.

skeptics.name: Patrik Korda
skeptics.title: Amateur trader
skeptics.excerpt: Thus, we have an answer before us: bitcoins are fiduciary media, or more specifically token money. From a monetary standpoint, as devised and formulated by Ludwig von Mises, they are on a par with the stuff you find at Chuck E. Cheese's.

skeptics.name: Heidi Moore
skeptics.title: Finance and Economics Editor, The Guardian US
skeptics.article: Confused about Bitcoin? It's 'the Harlem Shake of currency'
skeptics.excerpt: Of course, in a rational world, none of that will be written, except perhaps as satire. Bitcoin's crash is less of a currency crisis than an opportune moment for internet wisecracks.

skeptics.name: Joseph Weisenthal
skeptics.title: Executive Editor, Business Insider
skeptics.excerpt: Bitcoin? Nada. There's nothing keeping it being a thing. If people lose faith in it, it's over. Bitcoin is fiat currency in the most literal sense of the word.

skeptics.name: Matthew O'Brien
skeptics.title: Journalist
skeptics.article: Bitcoin Is the Segway of Currency
skeptics.excerpt: In other words, Bitcoin is a Ponzi scheme libertarians use to make money off each other—because gold wasn't enough of one for them.

skeptics.name: Matthew Yglesias
skeptics.title: Executive Editor, Vox
skeptics.article: Why I Haven't Changed My Mind About Bitcoin
skeptics.excerpt: My primary interest in Bitcoin is that I think it's a great platform for making jokes.

skeptics.name: Mark T. Williams
skeptics.title: Finance Professor, Boston University
skeptics.excerpt: Once sellers outnumber buyers, prices will eventually drop below $10, erasing all gains. This price collapse will occur by the first half of 2014.

skeptics.name: Alex Payne
skeptics.title: Developer and Angel Investor
skeptics.article: Bitcoin, Magical Thinking, and Political Ideology
skeptics.excerpt: Bitcoin represents more of the same short-sighted hypercapitalism that got us into this mess, minus the accountability.

skeptics.name: Charlie Stross
skeptics.title: Author
skeptics.article: Why I want Bitcoin to die in a fire
skeptics.excerpt: TL:DR; the current banking industry and late-period capitalism may suck, but replacing it with Bitcoin would be like swapping out a hangnail for Fournier's gangrene.

skeptics.name: Lisa Kramer
skeptics.title: "Serious Economist"
skeptics.excerpt: As a Serious Economist, I had been happily ignoring the recent bitcoin frenzy, safe in the smug knowledge shared by all Serious Economists that the surge in bitcoin value is a bubble that will soon pop.
